2.3 Hattiesburg Municipal Authority
Local Implementation: Hattiesburg Code Chapter 4, Article III, ยง4-26 through ยง4-35 implements floodplain management regulations that exceed minimum NFIP requirements

Freeboard Requirement: Hattiesburg Code ยง4-29 specifies 2 feet above BFE in most districts (exceeding the 18-inch state guidance)

Community Rating System: Hattiesburg is a CRS Class 7 community, providing 15% flood insurance premium reduction for property owners through enhanced floodplain management standards

Compensatory Storage: Verify compliance with potential volumetric "cut-and-fill" balance requirements under Hattiesburg Code ยง4-33(d)

3. Development Requirements
3.1 Engineering Analysis Requirements
No-Rise Certification Required: Projects in FEMA floodways must complete a No-Rise Certificate with hydraulic report to demonstrate no rise in the BFE, or pursue the Conditional Letter of Map Revision (CLOMR) process.

H&H Study Explained: H&H stands for "Hydrologic and Hydraulic" study. This is a computer modeling analysis that simulates how water flows through the floodway during a flood event. The study calculates whether proposed development will increase flood levels upstream or downstream. Think of it as a digital flood simulation that proves your development won't make flooding worse for neighbors.

CLOMR Process Explained: A Conditional Letter of Map Revision is a formal FEMA process used when development might increase flood levels. Instead of proving "no-rise," you can propose flood mitigation measures (like channel improvements) that offset any increase. FEMA reviews and pre-approves the concept before construction begins.
